question.title: Why is my static Java method returning a boolean being called twice in HAScript?
question.body:
I'm integrating Java methods into a HAScript environment and noticed an unexpected behavior when calling a method that returns a boolean.

Here’s my Java class:

public class Utils {
    public static class RuntimeState {
        public static int testCtr = 0;
    }

    public static int test_int() {
        RuntimeState.testCtr++;
        System.out.println("test_int: " + RuntimeState.testCtr);
        return RuntimeState.testCtr;
    }

    public static boolean test_bool(boolean pBool) {
        RuntimeState.testCtr++;
        System.out.println("test_bool: " + RuntimeState.testCtr);
        return pBool;
    }
}

When I run this HAScript:

<actions>
    <perform value="$Utils.test_bool(false)$" />
</actions>

or this:

<actions>
    <perform value="$Utils.test_bool(true)$" />
</actions>

The output is:

test_bool: 1
test_bool: 2

But when I run this HAScript:

<actions>
    <perform value="$Utils.test_int()$" />
</actions>

The output is:

test_int: 1

It seems like the test_bool method is being called twice, while test_int is only called once. Why is this happening?

How can I prevent the boolean-returning method from being invoked twice?
